build I20030227

Noticed the following in my .log:

in: "org.eclipse.core.resources".

this must be related to the long standing JIT problem of 21437 et al. the VM 
doesn't give us more stack trace information possibly due to inlining, JIT 
optimization, etc.

i've never been able to reproduce this myself, but it continues to be a 
serious problem for people. 

The AssertionFailedException must come from Core. As you can see from the 
TasksFilter.selectByAttributes(..) variants, we call a number of getAttribute, 
etc. methods on Markers and MarkerDeltas, otherwise I don't have any leads.

Moving to Core.

All the assertion failures in Marker and MarkerDelta are caused by illegal
arguments.  We should really change our code to use Assert.isLegal so that
illegal argument exceptions are thrown.

It looks like TasksFilter is probably invoking methods on MarkerDelta in this
case, since you're in a resource changed callback.  The getAttribute methods in
MarkerDelta throw an assertion failure if you request an attribute but provide
the wrong default type.  For example, if you call:

IMarkerDelta.getAttribute("key", "defaultValue")

but the attribute is actually an int or boolean, we throw an assertion failure.

So, this could be caused by anybody setting SEVERITY, PRIORITY, DONE, or MESSAGE
with an incorrect data type.

Old summary: 
  [Tasks] Assertion failed in TasksFilter.selectByAttributes

Changing title and severity to better reflect the new bug.

We could alternatively change the implementation of MarkerDelta.getAttribute to
be the same as Marker.getAttribute.  Marker.getAttribute simply returns the
default value if the actual value has the wrong data type, while
MarkerDelta.getAttribute throws an assertion failure.

MarkerDelta should work the same as Marker.
I think it's an error to through an assertion failed here.
Marker attributes are string valued.  The other methods are just conveniences.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34073 ***
